intro: Anoda punicea, commonly known as the scarlet fanflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of showy, pink to red flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping. Anoda punicea is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
